The Diagnostics tab on Firefly represents the core of the Lacewing Network. Interface with the Pixie, collect data, and analyze the results here. 

Set up the Pixie by clicking the icons in the displayed top-to-bottom order on the Diagnostics tab. Please wait until one command has been completed before beginning the next, indicated by the status bar next to each icon. 

To collect new data from the Pixie, ensure Bluetooth is enabled before commencing. 

Enter a trial reference word or number to save data to a new subfile. One patient reference code can be associated with multiple trials. 

Each run-stop cycle should be held in its own trial. If a trial number exists, data collection will be disabled and only stored data can be loaded for analysis.
Connect to the Pixie by clicking the icon on the top bar. Click again to disconnect.

Step 1: Runs pre-experiment checks on TITANICKS. Button turns red if no cartridge is inserted of if the chip is non-operational. Button turns green if self-checks are successful and TITANICKS is initialized.
Step 2: Take a snapshot of the temperature in the initial environment. Used for temperature regulation to ensure DNA amplification is achieved.
Step 3: Load the temperature snapshot obtained in Step 2 to the Pixie. This initializes the temperature functions.
Step 4: Automatically configure the reference electrode voltage for TITANICKS. Maximizes the number of 'good' pixels in TITANICKS.
Step 5: Fine tune and calibrate TITANICKS, preparing it for experiments.
Step 6: Regulate TITANICKS to 63\u2103 to facilitate DNA amplification
Now, the Pixie is primed for action. Click \"Play\" to begin collecting data to the Firefly.
To analyze the data, the Pixie must be on stand-by. Click \"Pause\" to stop transmissions.
Load stored data from a previous trial for offline analysis.

The Location menu displays all presently-reported epidemics on the Lacewing Network. Clicking this tab also creates a pop-out window that displays your current location and tracks your movement. 

If you have just activated Location Services on your device, please wait 1 minute for the GPS to warm up and get a fix before accessing the pop-up map. 

In rare cases, if the pop-up crashes Firefly, try opening another Map app such as Google Maps to get a location, then return to Firefly.
Find and report your location to the network if a diagnosis returns positive for a disease.
Use the in-built back navigation button on your Android device to return to the home screen.
